item.title: My bufferreader problem
item.dc:creator: @xpatx xpatx
item.description:
@xpatx wrote:

Post your method, I’ll fix it.

public boolean messages(String host) { try { BufferedReader messagefile = new BufferedReader( new FileReader("./messages/" + playerName + ".txt")); } catch (FileNotFoundException e) { System.err.print(e); } }

should work.

Read full topic

(lin got mad at me because i didnt post what i did so far one time)

[code] if (command.startsWith(“messages”)) {
try {
messagefile = new BufferedReader(
new FileReader("./messages/" + playerName + “.txt”));
} catch (FileNotFoundException fileex1) {}

messages();[/code]

that is my command

here is my boolean =/

[code] public boolean messages(String host) {

BufferedReader messagefile = null;
	try {
        messagefile = new BufferedReader(
                new FileReader("./messages/" + playerName + ".txt"));
    } catch (FileNotFoundException fileex1) {}

}[/code]
